pkgmetadata.longdescription: Grammatical Evolution // Grammatical evolution (see O'Neil, M. and Ryan, C. (2003,ISBN:1-4020-7444-1)) uses decoders to convert linear (binary or integer genes) into programs. In addition, automatic determination of codon precision with a limited rule choice bias is provided. For a recent survey of grammatical evolution, see Ryan, C., O'Neill, M., and Collins, J. J. (2018) doi:10.1007/978-3-319-78717-6.
